outcome: The above application has been filed by the petitioner under Section 483 of Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (for short, BNSS), 2023 seeking regular bail
full_text: 1 IN THE COURT OF THE SESSIONS JUDGE - VI, THIRUVANANTHAPURAM. Present : Sri. VISHNU K., ADDITIONAL SESSIONS JUDGE -VI Saturday, the 1 day of March, 2025 CRIMINAL M.C.No.505/2025 (Crime No.118/2025 of Kadinamkulam Police Station) PETITIONER/IACCUSED : Anil Kumar, aged 57 years, S/o.Sivasankarapillai, Manakkattil Veedu, Pazhanchira, Near Chintha Junction, Channankara, Kadinamkulam. By Adv. V.Shaji RESPONDENTS/COUNTER PETITIONERS:- 1. The State of Kerala, represented by Public Prosecutor, Thiruvananthapuram. 2. The l.S.H.O, Kadinamkulam Police Station, Kadinamkulam. By Addl.Public Prosecutor A.R. Shaji This Cril.M.C having been finally heard on 27..02..2025 and the Court on 01..03..2025 passed the following : ORDER The above application has been filed by the petitioner under Section 483 of Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (for short, BNSS), 2023 seeking regular bail in connection with Crime No.118/2025 of Kadinamkulam police station, registered for the offence punishable under sections 55 (a) and (i) of Kerala Abkrai Act | of 1077. 2. Petitioner is the sole accused in the above crime. 3.The prosecution allegation is that on 06/02/2025 at 10:15 am, the accused was found in possession of 1 litre of Indian Made Foreign Liquor in 5 bottles in an autorickshaw, for the purpose of sale in contravention of the provisions of the Abkari Act. Thus, the accused is said to have committed the above offences. 4. Heard both sides. 2 5, The learned counsel for the petitioner submitted that the petitioner was arrested on 06/02/2025 and he has been in judicial custody. The counsel appeared for the petitioner further submitted that the petitioner is innocent and he is falsely implicated in the case. He has not committed any offence as alleged by the prosecution. 6. On the other hand, the learned Additional Public Prosecutor opposed the bail application. 7. It is seen from the report filed by the Investigating Officer that the accused is in custody since 06/02/2025. Major part of the investigation is completed. The contraband articles are also taken into custody and produced before Court. Therefore, this court is of the view that further detention of the accused is not warranted, rather, the petitioner can be released on bail by imposing conditions. In the result, Criminal MC is allowed on the following conditions; (i). The petitioner shall be released on bail on his executing bond for Rs.50,000/- with two solvent sureties each for the like sum to the satisfaction of the Jurisdictional Magistrate. (ii). The petitioner shall report before the Investigating Officer every Monday until further orders or until final report is filed. Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, typewritten by her in the computer, corrected by me and pronounced in open Court on the 1* day of March, 2025. VISHNU K., ADDITIONAL SESSIONS JUDGE - VI J JS/SS: 3 ORDER IN CRIMINAL M.C.NO.505/2025 Dated:01/03/2025 4 5
